resources.string:
Kenya Ports Authority is a state corporation with the responsibility to "maintain, operate, improve and regulate all scheduled seaports" on the Indian Ocean coastline of Kenya, including principally Kilindini Harbour at Mombasa.
Other KPA ports include Lamu, Malindi, Kilifi, Mtwapa, Kiunga, Shimoni, Funzi and Vanga.
 Headquarters: Mombasa
 Jurisdiction: Kenya
 Founded: 1978
 
 Agency executives: :
 Michael Maina, Chairman;
 Daniel Manduku, Chief Executive Officer
 Parent agency: Transport
 Subsidiary: Mombasa Port
